arts.ttl: Mark Robins delivers verdict as Nathan Lowe starts life back at Stoke with goal
arts.sum: Mark Robins says he could hardly be surprised to see Nathan Lowe pop up in a goal-scoring position as he started life back at Stoke City by getting on the scoresheet. "He's come back in and I can't say it's too much of a surprise that he's got himself into good positions because that's what he's been doing week in, week out.

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs West Brom as Nathan Lowe revels in new start
arts.sum: A Stoke attack started when Tchamadeu made the brave call to dash inside with the ball inside his own half, slipping to Wouter Burger to release Lewis Koumas down the left wing. Burger: Pushed further forward to support Lowe and can play a useful pass into dangerous areas, like cross at start of second half for Lowe.

arts.ttl: Grady Diangana equaliser earns West Brom draw against Stoke
arts.sum: Stoke led following Lowe’s eighth-minute opener.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs West Brom as Mark Robins puts faith in Nathan Lowe
arts.sum: That is the only change that Robins makes to the side that won an FA Cup third round tie at Sunderland in extra-time last weekend, meaning Lowe will likely be flanked by Lewis Koumas and Andrew Moran. Lewis Baker is joined by Tatsuki Seko and Wouter Burger in midfield while Enda Stevens starts his first league game since November at left-back, with Ashley Phillips, Ben Wilmot and Junior Tchamadeu making up the back four.

arts.ttl: West Brom win transfer battle with Championship rivals – Medical booked in for Monday
arts.sum: Isaac Price has decided to join West Bromwich Albion ahead of Preston North End and will join the Baggies next week. That’s according to journalist Sacha Tavolieri, who reports the 21-year-old will be heading to the Hawthorns this month. A report yesterday indicated that West Brom and Preston were both in talks to sign Price The post West Brom win transfer battle with Championship rivals – Medical booked in for Monday appeared first on Sport Witness.

arts.ttl: West Brom vs Stoke City live - Team news from the Hawthorns - Stoke-on-Trent Live
arts.sum: Stoke are hoping to build on their first win under new manager Mark Robins, who oversaw his team come out on top in extra-time in last weekend's FA Cup third round tie at Sunderland. But it has been an eventful week at Clayton Wood, with Tom Cannon being recalled by Leicester, Stoke bringing back Nathan Lowe from Walsall, Alex Morris leaving and Ryan Shawcross taking his place in the first team coaching set-up.

arts.ttl: Rangers transfer clear out ramps up as Tom Lawrence lined up for Man Utd reunion but midfield 'target' set for West Brom
arts.sum: Lawrence's time at Ibrox has been plagued by injuries and he could be on the move

arts.ttl: Stoke City transfer state of play as New Year brings major changes
arts.sum: Robins said at his pre-West Brom press conference: "We’re working hard with the players we’ve got in the building and also to try to do something ourselves this January. Nathan Lowe, the 19-year-old striker, has returned as well after an exceptional loan spell at Walsall and England youth keeper Tommy Simkin, aged 20 and also shining on loan as Walsall march towards the League Two title, has been back to train under the new regime too so he can make his introductions.

arts.ttl: Stoke City loan shake-up will force Mark Robins to make a tweak or two
arts.sum: Ryan, as we know, is a club legend and I’m going to make a prediction here - he will be Stoke City manager one day. A fantastic FA Cup win at Sunderland was followed by the news that top scorer Tom Cannon had been recalled by parent club Leicester City.

arts.ttl: Nathan Lowe 'mature beyond years' as he makes big Stoke City step
arts.sum: “It’s two steps up but he’s a young player who’s full of confidence,” said Robins. With any player who’s playing in the front positions they have to add goals and assists and some point but we’ve got a young squad that we know is trying to find their feet in a really tough division in a tough environment.
